document.ModsDocTitle: The Australian Lynx Spiders (Araneae, Oxyopidae, Oxyopes) of the Godeffroy Collection, including the description of a new species
document.docAuthor: Baehr, Barbara C., Harms, Danilo, Duperre, Nadine & Raven, Robert
document.masterDocTitle: The Australian Lynx Spiders (Araneae, Oxyopidae, Oxyopes) of the Godeffroy Collection, including the description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Australian Lynx Spiders (Araneae, Oxyopidae, Oxyopes) of the Godeffroy Collection, including the description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Oxyopes quadrifasciatus L. Koch, 1878 Figs 16 A-E , 21D
581. Oxyopes quadrifasciatus L. Koch, 1878, 1020-1021, Taf. 89 Fig. 6 + 6 a, Australien, Peak Downs, Holotype (Mus. GODEFFROY Nr. 16499) (37) ( Rack 1961 ).

FEMALE HOLOTYPE (ZMH-A0000018), from Queensland, Peak Downs, "now large open cut coking coal mine in Queensland located 31 km SSE of Moranbah",
22°15 '9.60" S
,
148°10 '30.00" E
, Godeffroy Collection.

The female of Oxyopes quadrifasciatus can be separated from females of all other described Australian Oxyopes species by the inverted anchor-shaped scapus with triangular tip and short outward directed lateral lobes (Figs 16 C-E , 21 D). Male unknown.

caption.paragraph: Figure 16. Oxyopes quadrifasciatus L. Koch, 1878, female holotype (ZMH- A0000018): A, habitus, dorsal view; B, habitus, ventral view; C, epigyne, ventral view; D, epigyne, ventral view, cleared; E, epigyne, dorsal view, cleared. Scale bars: habitus 1.0 mm, epigyne 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Original records from Peak Downs in central Queensland. The ALA lists additional records from the Brisbane area, coastal Queensland, the Pilbara in Western Australia and near Melbourne that need to be checked.
